trans-unit.source: Specifies processing rules or option settings for the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader"></xref> XAML reader implementation.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReaderSettings"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReaderSettings"></xref> class by copying settings from an existing <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReaderSettings"></xref> object.
The existing <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReaderSettings"></xref> object to copy.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the underlying stream or text reader should be closed when the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader"></xref> is closed.
`true` if the underlying stream or reader should be closed when the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader"></xref> is closed; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether the reader should differ from the default <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader"></xref> behavior of how markup compatibility content is processed.

The default handling behavior for XML markup compatibility in <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader> is that the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader>, as provided for initialization, is wrapped in a created internal helper class.
This helper class reads the markup compatibility nodes separately and enters into the nodes based on markup compatibility of the schema context.
Suggested scenarios for setting <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReaderSettings.SkipXmlCompatibilityProcessing%2A> to `true` are:
You want to keep any markup compatibility content in the primary XAML stream.
You have already processed the markup compatibility because you are using a reader that can process markup compatibility content inline.
You choose to ignore XML compatibility conventions in your XAML reader implementation for reasons of performance.
`true` if the initiating reader is directly used, which means that XML compatibility markup is processed as part of the main stream and compatibility is not considered.
`false` if the default behavior is used, which processes XML compatibility separately.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets the language setting value that the reader may promote to writers that write `xml:lang` attributes in nodes.
The caller is responsible for making sure that the string you provide is appropriate for `xml:lang` usage.
The string to use for possible `xml:lang` output that is based on the reader.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether the XAML reader instructs any XAML writers to write `xml:space` attributes in nodes.
If that behavior is desired, this information is passed through shared XAML schema context.
The XML whitespace concepts are not robust enough to apply to XAML, and are typically ignored by XAML readers.
`true` if writers that are processing the XAML node stream can write xml:space="preserve" in output; `false` if `xml:space` attributes cannot be written in nodes.
